conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graphs of the truck and the bus to determine the maximum distance between them.
Initial velocity of the truck is 40 m/s and the initial velocity of the bus is 30 m/s.
Distance traveled by the truck until it stops is 400 m.
Distance traveled by the bus until it stops is 450 m.
Bus will have traveled 420 m when the truck has traveled 400 m.
Truck and bus will meet after the truck has traveled 400 m and the bus has traveled 420 m.
Time at which the truck and the bus meet is t = 6 s.
Truck and bus meet at the intersection of their velocity-time graphs at t = 10 s.
Distance between the truck and the bus at any time t is given by Δd = d_bus - d_truck - 30 m.
Distance traveled by the truck at time t is 20t.
Distance traveled by the bus at time t is 15t.
